audio_description: Hello foodies, welcome to Ismail Food Evality! Today we’re making the world-famous Malabar Chicken Dum Biryani. You may have eaten many chicken dum biryanis, but this Malabar version is unique — its method, ingredients, and flavors are all different. Try it once — you’ll definitely love it. Let’s start!

audio_description: This turns into a powder like this. You can store it in airtight jars and preserve it easily for 2–3 months. Now, for chicken masala, take 1-inch ginger and 5–6 garlic cloves.

audio_description: Usually, Keralites enjoy biryani with pappadam and pickle, followed by Suleimani tea — a great digestive. This is a very simple recipe. How is this Kerala special Malabar Chicken Dum Biryani? Like it? Want to try it? For the detailed recipe, visit www.wismyfood.com and tag me on Instagram if you try it!
